description: Erection of a warehouse and relocation of welfare facilities and security fencing
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted ( Location Plan, Existing Block Plan, Existing External Works, Proposed Block Plan, Proposed Elevations, Proposed Demolition Plan, Proposed External Works, Proposed Ground Floor Plan, Proposed Roof Plan, BREEAM Pre - Assessment, Energy Statement, Supporting Planning Statement and Transport Statement received on 19 February 2016 and Archaeological Evaluation received on 5 August 2016. ) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those stated on the approved drawings.

Condition : 4 - The footway and carriageway of The Parkway A312 must not be blocked during the construction and maintenance of the proposal. The construction of the proposal should not at any point encroach on the clear space needed to maintain the safe and uninterrupted flow of road users and pedestrians.
Condition : 5 - No vehicles associated with the construction of the development must park/load/unload on the pathway/carriageway of The Parkway A312 at any time
Condition : 6 - No skips or construction materials shall be kept on the footway or carriageway of the Transport for London Road Network at any time.

Condition : 7 - The parking and turning areas shown on the Transport Assessment dated March 2016 hereby approved shall be implemented prior to commencement of the use hereby approved and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved on the site full details including plans and elevations of cycle parking facilities shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to commencement of the use.

Condition : 10 - Prior to commencement of works (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant must submit for review and approval by the Lead Local Flood Authority final detailed drainage designs (including drawings) and an associated detailed maintenance plan for each of the drainage feature components (including routine maintenance tasks and frequencies and the responsible body/bodies). Evidence must also be submitted to demonstrate that the necessary agreements have been made with Thames Water to allow for connection into their existing surface water sewer network using the drainage system proposed for the site as agreed on 22nd July 2016 with the Lead Local Flood Authority.

Condition : 11 - Prior to occupation, the applicant must submit for review and approval by the Lead Local Flood Authority evidence that the drainage system has been built as per the final detailed drainage designs through the submission of photographs and copies of installation contracts, and written confirmation that the drainage features will be managed as per the detailed maintenance plan for the lifetime of the development.
Condition : 12 - The scheme shall be implemented in accordance with the Energy Statement V1.0 prepared by Frankham Consultancy Group dated November 2015.
